intro: Brachyscome ciliaris var. ciliaris, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Australia. It features dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers surrounded by silky, silver-gray foliage. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and has a mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
